title: Frank Lampard hits back at Sean Dyche over Callum Hudson-Odoi accusation
text:
Chelsea’s Callum Hudson-Odoi was booked for diving against Burnley on Saturday (Picture: Getty)

Frank Lampard has defended Callum Hudson-Odoi after the Chelsea winger faced a barrage of criticism from Burnley boss Sean Dyche.

The teenager was awarded a penalty during the closing stages of Saturday’s 4-2 win at Turf Moore but was subsequently booked for simulation by Michael Oliver after VAR overturned the original decision.

Dyche, who described Arsenal’s players as ‘dishonest’ following a defeat at the Emirates back in August, took issue with Hudson-Odoi’s antics, branding the England international’s attempts to con the match officials as shambolic.

‘It is shambolic how people dive about the place and we were told by the Premier League the worst you can get is a yellow card, so everyone has a chance to cheat once again and not get sent off.

‘I keep hearing the word respect, and I get shot down for saying this, but players should respect the game. They have got to do something more (than bookings). I feel worse it is a young player doing it.

‘They are the future and if they are diving now, we have massive trouble now in five or 10 years. We didn’t use to accept it. Now we do and I am the only one who goes on about it.’

Ahead of tomorrow’s Carabao Cup clash against Manchester United, Lampard took issue with Dyche’s claims and confirmed he felt no reason to warn Hudson-Odoi suggesting Dyche may not have had access to all angles of the incident.

‘I said nothing to him, nothing,’ revealed the Chelsea manager. ‘I asked him straight after the game. He said he got a touch. It might have been light but he had a hand on the back. I am not sure if Sean Dyche saw all the angles.’
